sections.title: Bloatmage (Class Overview)
sections.description: Overview of the Bloatmage class including role, alignment, hit die, and starting wealth.

sections.title: Weapon and Armor Proficiency (Bloatmage)
sections.description: Bloatmages gain no proficiency with any weapon or armor.

sections.title: Spells per Day/Spells Known (Bloatmage)
sections.description: When gaining a bloatmage level, the character gains new spells as if she had also gained a level in a previous arcane spellcasting class, but gains no other class benefits except spells per day, spells known, and increased caster level.

sections.title: Blood Pool (Bloatmage)
sections.description: A pool of blood points equal to bloatmage level that can be spent to cast spells without using spell slots, with dangerous consequences for exceeding the normal pool size.

sections.title: Bloodsurge (Bloatmage)
sections.description: A free action ability that allows the bloatmage to instantly gain extra blood points by rolling dice, usable a limited number of times per day with increasing potency.

sections.title: Hemophilia (Bloatmage)
sections.description: Bloatmages are more susceptible to bleed effects, with higher Heal check DCs to stop bleeding and losing blood points when suffering bleed attacks.

sections.title: Corpulence (Bloatmage)
sections.description: The bloatmage's massive size grants natural armor bonuses but reduces movement speed at higher levels.

sections.title: Absorb Bloodline (Bloatmage)
sections.description: By consuming fresh blood from sorcerers or bloodline-affiliated creatures, the bloatmage temporarily gains access to sorcerer bloodline powers for one hour.
